text:
Overview Description: requests for "http://www.louisiana.edu/Web" and
"http://www.louisiana.edu/Web/" are redirected to
"http://www.louisiana.edu/AboutUs/IndexAZ.shtml" even though expected behavior
is to reach "http://www.louisiana.edu/Web/"

Steps to Reproduce:
1) compile Apache and include following in "httpd.conf"
<Directory "/web/docs">
    Options FollowSymLinks Includes
    AllowOverride All
    Allow from all
</Directory>
2) include following in "/web/docs/.htaccess" (written on 1 line):
RedirectMatch 301 ^/Web/[Ii]ndex(.*) http://www.louisiana.edu/AboutUs/IndexAZ.shtml
3) request "http://www.louisiana.edu/Web" or "http://www.louisiana.edu/Web/"

Actual Results: redirection to "http://www.louisiana.edu/AboutUs/IndexAZ.shtml"

Expected Results: no redirection (i.e., reach "http://www.louisiana.edu/Web/")

Attempts to Resolve and Results:
1) commenting/pounding out RedirectMatch line in "/opt/httpd/htdocs/.htaccess"
results in requests for "http://www.louisiana.edu/Web" and
"http://www.louisiana.edu/Web/" reaching "http://www.louisiana.edu/Web/" as
expected; however, uncommenting line results in unexpected behavior
2) checked FAQ and bug report database but saw nothing applicable

Error Log: nothing reported

Server Log: request has status 200 and appears normal (1 line in log below)
www.louisiana.edu 130.70.132.115 - - [26/Feb/2004:08:55:32 -0600] "GET
/AboutUs/IndexAZ.shtml HTTP/1.1" 200 84266 "-" "Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows
NT 5.1; en-US; rv:1.4) Gecko/20030624 Netscape/7.1 (ax)"

Core: none
creator: dxh0844@louisiana.edu

text: *** Bug 27256 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
creator: dxh0844@louisiana.edu

text:
It is really unclear what bug you are reporting here.

When you make a request for a directory, apache uses the DirectoryIndex
directive to try to find a default page for that directory.  Obviously
your DirctoryIndex includes index.html, and when apache tries to grab
that file, it follows the redirect you have setup for that file.  That
doesn't seem like unexpected behavior to me.

If what you want is to redirect direct requests for index.html but
provide a directory listing on other requests for that directory,
then simply change the DirectoryIndex for that directory.

And in the future, please bring up questions like this on a user-support
forum like the users@httpd.apache.org list.  Then you can at least refine
your bug report a little before you submit it.

Thanks for using Apache.
creator: slive@apache.org
